title: [feature request] torch.prod supports torch.Size
body_html:
• PyTorch version: 0.3.0.post4
  • How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): conda
  • A script to reproduce the bug.
    torch.prod(torch.FloatTensor(10, 3, 3, 3).shape)
  • Error messages and/or stack traces of the bug
  File "<ipython-input-26-515266e5c0dc>", line 1, in <module>
    torch.prod(torch.FloatTensor(10, 3, 3, 3).shape)
TypeError: torch.prod received an invalid combination of arguments - got (torch.Size), but expected one of:
 * (torch.FloatTensor source)
      didn't match because some of the arguments have invalid types: (!torch.Size!)
 * (torch.FloatTensor source, int dim)
 * (torch.FloatTensor source, int dim, bool keepdim)
  • Context around what you are trying to do

I'm trying to count the total parameters of my model. I'd like to have the torch.prod func be able to take arguments of torch.Size. Same for the other arithmetic operations with torch.Size. I don't want to reinvent the wheel with iterating over dimensions neither import numpy to do the job.

body:
- PyTorch version: 0.3.0.post4
- How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): conda
- A script to reproduce the bug.
`torch.prod(torch.FloatTensor(10, 3, 3, 3).shape)`
- Error messages and/or stack traces of the bug
```
  File "<ipython-input-26-515266e5c0dc>", line 1, in <module>
    torch.prod(torch.FloatTensor(10, 3, 3, 3).shape)
TypeError: torch.prod received an invalid combination of arguments - got (torch.Size), but expected one of:
 * (torch.FloatTensor source)
      didn't match because some of the arguments have invalid types: (!torch.Size!)
 * (torch.FloatTensor source, int dim)
 * (torch.FloatTensor source, int dim, bool keepdim)
```
- Context around what you are trying to do

I'm trying to count the total parameters of my model. I'd like to have the `torch.prod` func be able to take arguments of `torch.Size`. Same for the other arithmetic operations with `torch.Size`. I don't want to reinvent the wheel with iterating over dimensions neither import numpy to do the job.
